column4: hello, i noticed that the 12.04 image says it is 701 MB does this mean it will not fit onto a CD-R?
awesome, thank you. i only have CD-Rs so i didn't wanna waste the time downloading the image if it wasn't going to fit
usb is the way to go
computer is too old to boot from USB
my girlfriend brought her old computer over here so that i can recover the data off of these old IDE hard drives
what do you think would be the most efficient way of transferring at least 100 gb of data from those old ide drives to my main computer?
external usb enclosure  is what i normally use.
what if i don't have any of that and am on a tight budget.. samba server maybe?
what about konqeror with fish:// protocol?
what is the technical term for that adapter?
and with that i can hook up both ide and sata hard disk to my computer?
i will definitely be investing in one of those, thanks for the tip
i'm out for the night, thanks for the tips. good night
